results.definition: something intended to misrepresent the true nature of an activity
examples: the holding company was just a blind

results.definition: make dim by comparison or conceal

examples: a person is blind to the extent that he must devise alternative techniques to do efficiently those things he would do with sight if he had normal vision

results.definition: not based on reason or evidence
a protective covering that keeps things out or hinders sight
examples: they had just moved in and had not put up blinds yet

results.definition: a hiding place sometimes used by hunters (especially duck hunters)
examples: he waited impatiently in the blind

results.definition: make blind by putting the eyes out
examples: The criminals were punished and blinded

results.definition: people who have severe visual impairments, considered as a group
examples: he spent hours reading to the blind

results.definition: unable or unwilling to perceive or understand
examples: blind to the consequences of their actions
